new Iot.Device.Nmea0183.FilterRule : string * Iot.Device.Nmea0183.TalkerId * Iot.Device.Nmea0183.SentenceId * seq<string> * Func<Iot.Device.Nmea0183.NmeaSinkAndSource, Iot.Device.Nmea0183.NmeaSinkAndSource, Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Sentences.NmeaSentence, Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Sentences.NmeaSentence> * bool * bool -> Iot.Device.Nmea0183.FilterRule
MemberSignature.Usage: new Iot.Device.Nmea0183.FilterRule (sourceName, talkerId, sentenceId, sinks, forwardingAction, rawMessagesOnly, continueAfterMatch)

Docs.param: Name of the source (Nmea stream name) for which the filter applies or * for all
TalkerId for which the rule applies or
SentenceId for which the rule applies or
Where to send the message when the filter matches
When the message is about to be sent, this method is called that can modify the message. First arg is the source of the message, second the designated sink.
The filter matches raw messages only. This is the default, because otherwise known message types would be implicitly duplicated on forwarding
True to continue processing after a match, false to stop processing this message
Docs.summary: A standard filter rule. When the filter matches

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ContinueAfterMatch As Boolean

Docs.summary: If this is true, filter testing is continued even after a match. If it is false (the default), no further filters are tested after the first match (which typically means that a message is only matching one filter)

MemberSignature.Value: .property instance class System.Func`4<class Iot.Device.Nmea0183.NmeaSinkAndSource, class Iot.Device.Nmea0183.NmeaSinkAndSource, class Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Sentences.NmeaSentence, class Iot.Device.Nmea0183.Sentences.NmeaSentence> ForwardingAction
Public ReadOnly Property ForwardingAction As Func(Of NmeaSinkAndSource, NmeaSinkAndSource, NmeaSentence, NmeaSentence)

Docs.summary: If non-null, this action can modify the message before it is being sent to the indicated sink. Note that the input message shall not be modified, clone it if necessary.
